data.title: pane drag bars active in the wrong panes
data.body:
Atom 1.31, 1.32 on OSX 10.10.5:
If i split the screen vertically, and then split the upper pane horizontally, the upper panes 'drag' bars are active in the lower pane. They do not show visually, but the cursor changes and I can drag them.

To recreate:
open a new window.
split vertically
click on upper pane
split horizontally
You should have 3 panes now - something like this:
![3panes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4030906/11902009/d0e3e8cc-a563-11e5-9c0b-411387b14c7b.png)

NOW - hover the cursor in the LOWER pane in line horizontally with the split line between the panes in the upper half of the window. You will see the cursor change to the pane split double arrow, and if you click and drag you can change the pane size of the upper pane.

data.title: Atom Saving files but actually not saving ! help please
data.body:
atom is behaving weirdly since few days ! Everytime i save a file atom is saving it but the changes are not saved.
   What i actually mean is , suppose i make changes to a css file atom saves it but on opening the same css with some other editor the new changes are not seen ! Even browser does not reflect any changes.
     Since last week it was happening only with javascript files , so only for javascript i had to use notepad++ and i ignored the issue !
    Today its happening with css file too ! i dont want to switch the editor since i like atom. 

I googled for the issue  but all were related to atom freezing etc. In my case atom does not freeze or doesn't even throw error ! Its just saving changes for itself....

data.title: Matching bracket is not found after first click after Select Next
data.body:
Have the following text open:

```
{
  foo
  foo {
  }
}
```
1. Place the cursor somewhere on the first "foo".
2. Activate "Find And Replace: Select Next" (bound to cmd-D on OS X by default) twice so that both "foo"  occurrences are selected.
3. Click to the right of the the closing brace on line 4 to place the cursor immediately to the right of it.
4. Notice that the brace and its partner are not underlined as they usually should be when you place the cursor touching a brace.
5. Activate "Bracket Matcher: Go To Matching Bracket" (ctrl-M on OS X by default).
6. See that the cursor jumps to before the opening brace on line 1 instead of the opening brace on line 3.

data.title: Atom won't open anymore after a crash
data.body:
After some time Atom "Stop responding", After i close the program 1-2 processes of atom still continue running (can't stop them in task manager) also i can't open Atom anymore (even in the safe mode) without rebooting the system.
- Atom version 1.3.2
- Windows 7

As far i remember the issue was present even without community packages.

data.title: Editor becomes unresponsive when opening files
data.body:
I haven't been able to reproduce it consistently, but several times today I (as well as one of my co-workers) have had Atom lock up and become unresponsive. It seems to only happen though when I open a file in my project (but not every file and if I close the application and open that same file again it works fine).

Here is what I get after OS X closes the app: http://pastebin.com/Uve2600f

Here is my info:

Atom: 1.3.2
OS: OS X 10.11

data.title: Atom freezes when opening
data.body: I managed to get Atom into a state where I cannot open it until I run in safe mode once.  I copied my .atom/storage directory.  I notice several files that begin with "editor-" and then have some sort of hash in the name; there's only one that appears to be particularly recent.  Are there any parts of it I could post that might help with diagnosis?

data.title: Release notes in editor not updating
data.body: My version of Atom is up to date but the release notes page is stuck on an older version and keeps showing the "restart and update" button which closes Atom but doesn't restart the editor and the button doesn't disappear.

data.title: Pressing End key twice should move to end of line
data.body:
Open a document with a long line (example attached), so that it wraps. 
1. Press the End key. The cursor should move to the end of the screen line. This works correctly.
2. Press the End key again. The cursor should move to the end of the logical line. However nothing happens.

This works correctly in other editors: Sublime Text and Notepad++.

Similarly, pressing the Home key twice should always move the cursor to the start of logical line.

[alice.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/65536/alice.txt)

data.title: Atom fails to reopen windows when relaunching
data.body:
1. Open Atom 1.3.2 on OS X 10.11.1.
2. Add a project folder, leave some tabs open, and close Atom.
   - Repeat Step 2 multiple times for extra fail
3. Reopen Atom by double-clicking a file associated with it, outside any project.
4. Atom completely forgets what was last open, and launches with A window open to double-clicked file's folder, with single tab for the double-clicked file.

After Step 4, depending on the circumstances, Atom may recover A open project (for example by `atom project/folder`. However, double-clicking a file within that folder, or manually reopening a file, usually results in the open tabs being lost, and multiple open windows are always lost.

data.title: Cannot open the same file multiple times
data.body:
1. Drag a file into Atom.
   - Atom opens a new window, or adds it to an existing one.
2. Open a second window.
3. Attempt to open the same file in the second window.
   - Atom refuses to open it, taking you back to the first window.

Tested on Atom 1.3.2, OS X 10.11.1. Even notepad lets you open a file multiple times. And no, splitting it into a new pane (`Cmd+K, right`) does not work. I need to view the unedited file in one window and the edited file in another, possibly making divergent edits.

Bizarrely, if the original window is split with `Cmd+K, right` on that exact tab, opening it in another pane, and that second view is dragged into a new window, then this works (even though dragging the split tab back into the first pane hilariously [crashes](10109) atom).

data.title: Crash when dragging already present file to a pane
data.body:
1. Open a file.
2. `Cmd+K, right` to open it in a neighboring pane.
3. Drag the new view into the original pane.
4. Atom crashes.

This should have worked fine. There should be no problems with multiple tabs simultaneously editing one file.

data.title: Cannot rename project folder
data.body:
I can't seem to be able to rename or otherwise change title of a folder in sidebar.

Steps to reporoduce:
1. Add new project folder. If that matters, this is huge directory on a filesystem mounted over not-so-fast fuse, some parts of it are read-only, I think parent folder of the project is read-only.
2. Notice that display name is not very useful (too generic in my case - I will likely end up with many folders with the same name); try to rename it.

Expected result:
- I can change display name of the folder.
- Or, at least, I get meaningful error message

Actual result:
- Nothing happens - no rename, no error.

Confusion:
- Does 'rename' means rename on filesystem or is it only changing display name?

Atom 1.3.1-3937312 (built from source if that matters)

data.title: Editor becomes unresponsive when switching windows
data.body:
Everytime i switch back to the editor, it freezes for around 5-20 seconds.
I'm on windows 10 with atom 1.3.2

data.title: Add a git commit editor to Atom like in VS Code
data.body:
The "commit builder" is a really good feature of the VS Code, is there any plane to make something similar in Atom in the future? 

![screenshot 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4706265/11870773/e4095ef8-a4ca-11e5-95e3-b02149c84ef1.png)

data.title: Detecting file language when using a template extension
data.body:
Hi,

Atom is able to detect the my file is a Shell script when the extension is `.sh`. Sometimes, however, the extension is hidden by a template format, such as `.sh.j2` for Jinja templates.

I don't know what the correct approach should be or if it's already possible, but I'd like to be able to ignore specific extensions, such as `.j2` and use the previous suffix instead.

Thanks,
Warren.

data.title: Keybinding for toggling comments duplicated
data.body:
How can I solve this:
ctrl-/ Toggles line comments
ctrl-; Also toggle line comments but is not listed on keybindings
Now I want to make a new keybinding for ctrl-; but the line comment bind always overrides my keybind.

data.title: Release Notes is outdated
data.body:
Displaying the releases notes (help > Release Note) displays releases until 1.1.0.
But the last Atom release is 1.3.2 (About Atom displays this proper release).

data.title: Ubuntu (15.10) : Atom not responding
data.body:
Hi, 

I have been using atom earlier. Uninstalled it due to certain strange actions ( cannot click on the text on editor ) .

Installed again with `dpkg -i` command.

```
$atom --version
1.3.1

$ apm links
/home/hari/.atom/dev/packages (0)
└── (no links)
/home/hari/.atom/packages (0)
└── (no links)

$apm install --check
Checking for native build tools ✓
```

Ran `atom --safe` still it is not responding . The menu `project` and `find` have no submenus. When you click on many of the submenus  Eg : ( about ) it cannot even show the about information.

Tried opening folder from safe mode and it worked.

> Edit : once only . Cannot open the debug bar for it is not responding either.

Not sure what is happening. Tried many times.

There is no plugins installed currently. The old `~/.atom` folder was removed before the fresh install.

data.title: Release Notes stuck at release 1.1.0
data.body:
I've been upgrading Atom with every new release (Currently at 1.3.2), but the release notes have been stuck showing version 1.1.0 as the latest version and also showing the Restart and Update button when viewing the release notes

Clicking the Restart and Update button just closes Atom and it does not restart automatically.

I'm on Mac OS 11.2. This was also a problem on 11.1.

![screen shot 2015-12-16 at 21 13 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2569415/11859536/d912bfda-a439-11e5-8220-b530a5453a88.png)

data.title: Atom Fails to Initialize
data.body:
I did not update Atom or run a brew update, and now, seemingly out of nowhere, Atom will not launch. This is what I see upon the application opening. 
![screen shot 2015-12-16 at 7 47 26 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5178017/11858254/f1e7bd32-a42d-11e5-886b-96591bae5da3.png)

I have tried uninstalling and then reinstalling (using appcleaner to remove dependencies) as well as installing through brew cask and all to no avail. I'm not sure what the error is here but even when I have the application open I cannot access any of the menus to even check for or run through an update flow.

![screen shot 2015-12-16 at 7 49 01 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5178017/11858300/52bf7104-a42e-11e5-91f7-f168f4a52f27.jpg)

data.title: Atom 1.3.1 Hangs when opening files of the same name in similar folder names
data.body:
[crashTest.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/64668/crashTest.zip)
Directions to reproduce:
1. Unzip file.
2. Open the root folder of the zip as a project
3. Open all of the index.js files
4. Upon opening the third index.js file, Atom will hang.
